review.reviewBody: I don't know what Canada Goose is thinking. I am a size 6, small in CG items and this coat looks ridiculously huge, it has 3 snapping-on-the-outside waist adjustments that look absurd. Is CG trying to make a size small fit several sizes all at once? It is horrible! Returning it. I own other CG coats, Moncler, Patagonia also. I hope the others aren't trying to cut corners like CG seems to be doing.
review.name: Crazy sizing

review.reviewBody: I bought a similar jacket two years ago and this one fits way too tight, specially in the chest area. I wear a sweater underneath this jacket all the time but this should not cause it to hurt me to wear this jacket. Very disappointed in North Face.
review.name: Fits tight

review.reviewBody: Great product! Much warmer than any other jacket I have ever tried (including all north face jackets)
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket. It is easily packable/stowable. Great for travel. Super warm and great for any adventure. I unfortunately snagged it on my first trip with it so am dealing with having a patch kit that doesn't really want to stay patched. But that's my problem, not the jacket's! The only thing I might have considered, personally, is the hooded version.
review.name: Love it! Would buy again, yet with hoodie.

review.reviewBody: The yellow fabric is slightly transparent so the darker feather material makes it look like there is a greenish colored stain on the jacket itself.
review.name: Comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: While impressively warm to be so lightweight, There is no warmth when all of the zippers break and The North face will not stand behind their warranty. With a worthless warranty and being unable to find replacement zippers that fit the coat is useless..
review.name: Very lightweight, but useless.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Durable,attractive, goes great with any casual wardrobe
review.name: I have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the fit and warmth. The only reason it's not a 5 star is it sheds feathers.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for my 18-year-old grandson. We live in the Northern CA Sierras and he's going to college in Michigan. It's lightweight and the perfect jacket for any type of cold weather. In addition, it's not bulky, packs and travels easily and the Cave Blue color is perfect on him. However, the color should be called Cove Blue. Makes more sense . It was an excellent purchase.
review.name: Excellent purchase!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At first I thought I should've bought the small instead of the medium because it fit a bit loose. But after running it through the dryer for about 30 minutes it fit snugger. So warm! Also love the chest pocket to store the fob. The only drawback to this jacket is the price. I'm so paranoid about hooking it on something and ripping it.
review.name: My first North Face jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, warm and packable into itself. Great for travel and everyday versatility.
review.name: Light, warm and packable

review.reviewBody:
Like others have already written, these shoes are soft and comfy.  That's the only pro for me.

I have only climbed for a couple of years, and gyms only, so perhaps I need the reassurance of a stiffer shoe on smaller foot chips?  I am def not a fan of how soft they are.

I have only worn the Arpia, Miura, Skwama, and these.  I wear street shoe size.

I plan to keep these as my "backup" shoes
review.name: Soft shoes

review.reviewBody: I?ve been climbing for 46+ years. I?ve owned EBs, RRs, PAs, & my first pair of sticky rubber shoes were Boreal Fires bought from Ray in Joshua Tree in 1984. I bought these specifically for gym climbing along with a pair of La Sportiva Skwama?s. I bought these because I have a wide (EE) forefoot and these shoes are known to have a wide forefoot. I bought my street shoe size. They were snug out of the box but after 10 minutes of climbing, they molded to my feet and are spectacularly comfortable while climbing (I do yank them immediately off after I finish a pitch).  I find myself using these more than the Skwamas because there is no break-in period required and the sole is more sensitive (but likely not as good edging). They climb well right out of the box. The rubber seams pretty soft (and sticky!) so I don?t know how they will wear. I try to hit the gym for two 3+ hour sessions twice a week, so if I?m allowed, I?ll write a postscript to this review on how they are wearing and performing.  Beware that if you have a narrow foot these shoes may have to be sized differently or may not work for you - there may be too much volume in the shoe for your foot.
review.name: Ready For Action Right Out Of The Box

review.reviewBody:
I've never written an online review before but I would love for Scarpa to make this shoe until the end of time. I've been climbing for a decade (5.13/v9) and this is the most comfortable shoe i've ever worn and still basically has a good performance as top end shoes like the Solution or Instinct.  It's very soft, probably the softest I've worn, but can still edge , especially on overhangs. The heel is near perfect. The strap doesn't break. The rubber is Scarpa house made, but I think performs nearly as well as XS Grip 2 inside and out and lasts significantly longer. Backcountry often has the shoes for sale for $104! A deal that cannot be beat. 

Your feet wont hurt, performance is top tier. Thats it. Actually, thats not it...the design is very aesthetic as well, they look sleek, simple and well made.  Buy them so Scarpa keeps making them and we can all wear them for forever.

I wear a 40.5 in Solutions, and a 41.5 in other Scarpas and the Veloce is PERFECT at 41 (M9to 9.5 street shoe). Both regular and LV (or women's whatever they call them) of this shoe are the same in my experience, so choose the color for you.

Also, I didn't get anything for this review, but Backcountry does have great customer service and shipping. Maybe send me a special treat Backcountry if this review makes you beaucoups of $$$?
review.name: Buy them, perfect bouldering shoe

review.reviewBody: Good for beginner. Wearing this shoe isn't that panic. Just work great in gym.
review.name: Simply Great

name: Veloce Climbing Shoe
Veloce Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I bought several of these and have already used four for various reasons:  

1.  Two of my valve cores had too much sealant clogging its effectiveness to the point where cleaning it out became almost moot.  

2.  I had a bent valve core after attempting to use my stem cap to unscrew it.  Sticking with the Park Tool core remover going forward.  

3.  I could not unscrew the valve core to pump up my tire.
review.name: A much-need replacement

review.reviewBody: You could get cheaper ones in bulk on amazon but they aren't quality and you will replace them ten times more often. These simply work.
review.name: Quality product. The only one to order

review.reviewBody: Perfect replacement valve core. Nice spare to have.
review.name: A MTB Must

comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our producsts.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Weâ€™re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I really liked these pants for hiking. Super lightweight and joggers allow me to wear them like capris. Used them SUPing and they dried wicked fast and the fit is very comfortable. My only complaint is only one of the rubber tips on the drawstring came off after washing, made me sad considering how much they were. But overall my favorite pants this summer!
review.name: Bought every color

review.reviewBody: Great joggers! Comfy, lightweight fabric with a relaxed fit. These are a bit shorter in length than my other joggers. Iâ€™m 5â€™6 and the hem falls a couple of inches above my ankles.
review.name: Great joggers!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fabric is one of my all-time favorites from Marmot!  I not only own the pants, but also multiple pairs of the shorts, and a skort!
review.name: Comfortable, Lightweight, and Perfect!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved these joggers so much that I got them in 2 colors. The green matches a pair of elda shorts and sports bra I also got from marmot, because I wanted to wear them as an outfit and have longer and shorter pant options hahaha  

These are so comfortable and STRETCHY. I packed them in my climbing pack and one day when the crag was cold, a male friend of mine (Much larger than me) took them out of my bag and wore them and it fit him because of the stretch. That stretchy material is also nice when climbing because thereâ€™s zero restriction to your movement.
review.name: Cute comfortable and stretchy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great lightweight pants, huge fan of the waist fit. I am 5â€™1, 100 lbs, and my only complaint is the pants are too long in the smallest size. Wish there was a shorter inseam so they fit better around the calf, but otherwise, my fave pants.
review.name: Marmot Pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Iâ€™m 5â€™1â€, 100 lbs. these pants are a great fit at XS! they do go pretty long, but i can pull them up to my calves bc of the elastic!
review.name: Great fit and fabric!!

review.reviewBody: These are so cute on - very flattering and an awesome lightweight fabric!  Would be great with sneakers or birks - definitely cute enough to wear out and about (not just hiking or lounging)!  Buying my second pair.  LOVE the contrasting drawstring.
review.name: MUCH cuter than pictured....

name: Elda Jogger - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR 2-Person Mess Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great product insure my daughter will love it. Xmas 2023
review.name: Great product insure my daughter

review.reviewBody: The kit was exactly what I expected, great design/quality product.
review.name: MSR Design and Quality

review.reviewBody: I purchased this set for my wife and me for short to mid length hikes. The weight correlates with the strong construction and the ability to be creative with its nesting features allows it to ride in my MSR pot and hold other items as well.
review.name: Worth the weight.

review.reviewBody: The set is nice and relatively low weight for the materials used. The cups are heavy. The main drawback is upon the inaugural cleaning of the product, before it was taken out into the field, I submerged the cups in the sink to clean them with a washcloth and detergent, cleaned them, rinsed them and then the blue cup seemed to have taken on water between the grey liner and the blue cup. This indicates there is a break in the seal where water can get into the insulating area and mold can now potentially grow. The green cup does not have this problem. I have contacted the manufacturer out of concern.
review.name: One of the cups has a defect

review.reviewBody: Totally love the convenient and light-weight design of this little kit. The lidded thermal cups pack neatly in the dishware for easy storage. I took them for just an overnight backpacking trip and found them to be just the thing for an easy dinner and coffee with breakfast-kind of expedition. Easy to clean and overall just what I was looking for.
review.name: 2-Person Mess Kit

review.reviewBody: I have owned this for a year now and it has been the perfect fit for me.
review.name: Must have

review.reviewBody: My wife and I are growing our back country gear supply, and we picked up the MSR mess kit prior to a multi-day bike trip. We also added the French press attachment. Couldn't be happier. The size, straining lid, coffee cups are perfect.
review.name: Perfect for the Bike

review.reviewBody: My wife and I enjoy having the MSR - 2 Person Mess Kit as it's light weight and store easily into itself and fits in the bottom of any backpack, easy to clean and the quality you expect from MSR.
review.name: Light weight and storage

review.reviewBody: I actually won this kit from MSR on a facebook contest, it's an awesome kit! this kit would be great for partner hiking and I have zero problems with it. Kinda bulky for solo hiking, but all around a great kit!
review.name: great kit for couples hike

review.reviewBody: Great for impromptu day trips and picnics, in addition to long hikes!
review.name: Light and durable

name: 2-Person Mess Kit

review.reviewBody: Used these in varied climates and conditions. Worked really well. They should be the standard tent pegs instead of the regular ones that bend easily and pull out of the ground with ease.
review.name: Should be standard

review.reviewBody: I am always bending stakes when I am camping, it is nice to have good quality replacements.
review.name: Tent stakes

review.reviewBody: It is still winter in Montana and I havenâ€™t used them yet

review.reviewBody: Just finished West Coast Trail and these worked great in sand and dirt. Awesome spikes!
review.name: Must haveâ€¦.

review.reviewBody: Got them in on time and righ away decided to setup my tent in backyard and wow very impressed, the cheap mickey mouse stakes that was used prior could not hole the vestibules alwasy slid out, thes MSR grounhogs not only held both sides of the clips that hole the vestibule but felt like these stakes can hole everything mother nature will send its way; so yeah very impressed
review.name: Wow Amazing

review.reviewBody: They keep a tent in place. They are solidly built and slide into the ground easily. Another winner from MSR! Everybody says go ultra-lite. But the titanium ultra-lite stakes just donâ€™t hold up. I recommend these stakes for everyone.
review.name: BUY NO OTHER!!

review.reviewBody: very light and strong, with a rock they will even drive in hard pack Tennessee clay.
review.name: very light and strong, with

review.reviewBody: Used several Groundhog tent stakes this weekend in very cold and windy conditions. Placing them in the hard or soft ground and removing was fairly easy, probably easier than my buddy and his plastic and in style stakes, he even snapped one. I also appreciate the reflective string, which makes them easy to see at night when trying to take that late night relief.
review.name: Only stake for me

review.reviewBody: Regardless of the surface they're going on, these are by far the best tent stakes I've ever used. Not the lightest but definitely the burliest. They do not move, even when the wind is whipping around and will keep the tent put.
review.name: The only stakes for me

review.reviewBody: I've purchased a pack of these with every tent that I have. These stakes are durable and light weight.
review.name: Best Stakes

description: Buy the Giordana AV Extreme Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AV Extreme Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana AV Extreme Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The other reviews of this jacket are spot on, it is the one you want for the coldest days. The alpha direct coverage is generous, covering the front and back torso and 2/3 of the arm circumference, all the way down. This stuff needs air to work, and the Event material does that while still feeling windproof. It is eerie how well this combination works in keeping you dry. Regarding sizing, I can't do better than CC's own description; if you want to ride with a single layer go by the size chart, if you're going to layer on more heavily, size up.
review.name: Absolutely top notch

review.reviewBody: I owns the AV300 jacket as well and have worn it for a number of seasons. I live in New England and regularly ride in the cold mornings. The AV300 works fine and blocks the wind well. I would wear it over a base layer and a long-sleeve jersey downs to the 20's. In contrast, I was able to wear the AV Extreme over a base layer and a long-sleeved jersey down to the 10's in addition to the windchill close to 0. My top was warm and toasty. In addition, the AV Extreme jacket is extremely "breathable." I keep my wallet in one of the rear pockets. When I returned from my ride, the side of the wallet that was facing my body was wet due to the water vapor from my body. No accumulation inside the jacket at all. This is a fatalistic winter jacket. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Best winter jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket has exceeded my expectations for warmth. It feels light at first but in temps of 25-40* with a light wind it has kept me perfectly comfortable. Whether in the dark or light out. And best of all I'm dry inside with no moisture on my arms or torso- light baselayer still dry. Fitwise true to size with arms not too tight and perfect across the chest- no pulling or bunching. Back stays down over your butt and no poofiness at the stomach. I don't usually write reviews on jackets but this one is truly amazing.
review.name: Simply Amazing

review.reviewBody:
Super warm and breathable.  Yes, spendy, but is everything I expected to get.
With a lightweight wool base layer, 40 degrees feels warm.  With a heavy wool base layer, 30 degrees is plenty comfortable.  I don't go out lower than that because my feet get too cold, but I suspect 20-25 degrees is doable with this jacket.
I sized up because I don't like too snug of a fit and it's just right.  If you like your kit tight I'd say it's true to size.
review.name: Makes me wish for colder temps

name: AV Extreme Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Pretty quality. I am 5â€™10, 170, usually a large but I ordered a size up for extra steez. I like the length, itâ€™s a little boxy but roomy enough for a beacon, etc. The front middle pockets seem good for when I wear a backpack. I like the way the bottom pockets lie, stuff wonâ€™t fall out easily if theyâ€™re open. The hood also seems to be a good size for a helmet. My only concern is the zipper pulls are very thin and light so possibly not the most durable. Also donâ€™t need the powder skirt as I am a bibs person so kind of wished it detached. Otherwise very functional and looks good!

description: Buy the Therabody Theragun Prime Plus online or shop all Training from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Theragun Prime Plus
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therabody Theragun Prime Plus online or shop all Training from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] You should include an adaptor for existing UBS connections to wall outlets. Very inconvenient,
review.name: UBS connection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The new Plus series from Theragun are a nice upgrade from the previous models. The Prime Plus has great build quality and the cold/heat attachments are a game changer for recovery.
review.name: Nice Upgrade!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved my previous Theragun we used to take it everywhere the patented design makes it easy for self use I havenâ€™t used this with the heat yet as I bought it fr my husband for christmas but cannot wait!
review.name: Excited

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just upgraded from Theragun Pro 3 to the Prime Plus and I love it. It offers the same power but is more compact and much quieter. Highly recommend for those wanting a more budget friendly option without sacrificing power.
review.name: Quiet yet powerful

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This thing is amazing for recovery. Use this multiple times a day. Should have bought this sooner
review.name: Impressed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After a few weeks of consistent use, I noticed a significant decrease in the intensity of my radicular symptoms. While it didn't "cure" the underlying nerve issue, the Theragun dramatically improved my daily function by reducing muscle tension and improving blood flow. This resulted in less frequent flare-ups and increased mobility.
review.name: Radicular pain improved

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Theragun is so much nicer than our original one. It is quiet and has a heated tip. It really feels good on sore muscles!
review.name: Great Theragun

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] LOVE IT!!! Use it daily for my pre-workouts and after-workouts. Helps soothe my muscles.
review.name: Prime Plus Theragun

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using the previous pro model and recently updated my Theragun to the new Prime Plus, and I am completely satisfied with it. It has sufficient battery life, is quiet, and I love the heated head.
review.name: Love the heating function

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Helps with soreness and recovery post workout better than other leading brands I have tried. I find the heated massage especially relieving however use sparingly because it drains the battery quickly.
review.name: Best massage gun yet!

name: Theragun Prime Plus

review.reviewBody: Great quality. Lightweight but keeps me warm with a light sweater or sweatshirt down to 20 fahrenheit degrees. I am an athletic 5'9 woman , 163 #, bought the Men's Large. Plenty of room for layering. Sleeves are long. I get compliments on the green.
review.name: Great Lightweight Warm Jacket

review.reviewBody: Fits extremely well. No restrictions on movement. Lightweight. This will be my regular for years to come.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: A great feeling warm jacket! I have a 40" chest, 34" waist, 160 lbs and the medium fits great. Have worn in temps ranging from mid 30s to mid 40s and have been warm with just a cotton long sleeve under it. Love the stretch of the durable fabric and the matte green color. Also, this jacket doesn't have the "marshmallow look" of other downs. Overall, this is the best down jacket I have owned and look forward to years of use.
review.name: A Great Jacket

review.reviewBody:
This jacket ticks many boxes for me!! I love the medium weight and fitâ€¦ I can wear it with a t-shirt or several insulating layers and still not feel restricted at all! 
It breathes incredibly well for its weight and somehow breathes well enough for that difficult time in the morning where the temps go from well below freezing up to 50degrees in less to an an hourâ€¦ 
Iâ€™m 5â€™,9â€ 185lbs and it fits really well!

Itâ€™s a hit too heavy to use indoors or as a down sweater but the â€œLiteâ€ version would be perfect for this! 
Also, the finish is a textured mat that you can see, feel and hearâ€¦ if youâ€™re hyper-sensitive to those things this is not the finish for youâ€¦ but the DWS works really well for lite perceptionâ€¦
review.name: Amazing medium weight jacket!!

review.reviewBody:
Stretchdown is my favorite product. Function is key for my clothing and MHW nailed it. Awesome outer material, durable enough to withstand a 30+ lbs. pack and super agile when using in any activity situation, including flying. This year's colors are awesome and sizing is available for everyone too, from super athletic up to the Large and Fit Club. 6' 0" 245 lbs. and the XL is perfect with a thin-med layer underneath. Favorite 33Âº F jacket.

To MHW, don't change a thing except... give us a synthetic option, inter cuff, and charcoal lined armpits, worth paying up for little-BIG features. Thanks for the real world sizes.
review.name: Tough enough!!! MHW sticks to sizing for all.

review.reviewBody: this is the one I have been looking for, very lightweight and thin but very warm,
review.name: very warm and lightweigth

review.reviewBody:
Great combination of style and function. The flex and movement you get is amazing. Lightweight with excellent insulation. Makes me wish for some colder days. Far and away the best Winter jacket that I've ever owned.
I'm 5'11 and 165 and Medium fits very well.
review.name: Lives up to the Hype!

review.reviewBody: There are some people that criticize the super ds for being a few ounces more than other down jackets, but forget them. You get a full range of motion, no cold spots, and feel like youâ€™re wrapped in up comfortably in a blanket no matter which way you move around. The fabric feels incredibly premium and more durable than offerings from ArcTeryx or Patagonia and the matte finish is easy on the eyes. The fit is spot on with room for a sweater without being baggy and the adjustment cords are simply perfect. Mountain Hardwear didnâ€™t cut any corners making the best down jacket Iâ€™ve ever tried and I canâ€™t for the life of me think of any ways they could possibly improve on the design. Seriously, just try the super DS itâ€™s an absolute no-brainer.
review.name: The Best Down Jacket Iâ€™ve Tried

review.reviewBody: It seems to be well made. Zippers work well
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: I liked this jacket so much, I bought one for my wife. At first I thought the snug fit would be too restrictive, but the stretch fabric makes it perfect. Allows all the movement I need for skiing and other outdoor activities. It's trim enough to fit easily under my Mountain Hardware Goretex shell. Very comfortable and very warm. I love it.
review.name: Love this jacket!

name: StretchDown Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes about eight months ago, and they do the trick. I don't mind the laces, but even someone who prefers velcro might be surprised with how quick and easy they are to tighten and adjust. I bought them to fit my foot snuggly, maybe even a little tight, but it wasn't quite tight enough because I now find after some time that I could've downsized further. The top certainly stretches out a bit, which adds comfort but doesn't keep up the performance unless you've downsized enough. The biggest thing was that the tension that many shoes have pulling the toe down is usually a lot stronger, even for some moderate or neutral shoes. These shoes really round out if you're wearing them while you're not climbing, especially if you're walking around and standing in them for a while. This isn't a problem if you're not climbing past a certain grade, but since they drift towards neutral after a while, it can be difficult to stick to small footholds when you're sending hard since they're not super sticky. After climbing with them enough, I ended up progressing past the abilities of the shoes, and I needed something more aggressive, so I upgraded to the solutions. They are stickier, more aggressive, and I downsized more with them. This happened quicker than I expected, given I was upgraded to this shoe from another shoe, so I'd recommend picking up the Finales as a first shoe, as it's neutral enough to be comfortable for a beginner but performs up a to a decent grade. The padding inside the shoes could be better, I notice a big difference between it and and other shoes, but it's not terrible. I still use these as a beater shoe, mostly when I'm going outside or any other time I'll be standing around or not sending as hard. Otherwise they hold up well and they do what they need to.
review.name: Good shoes for a beginner

review.reviewBody: If sized properly, this shoe performs great inside and outside. My street shoe size is a 43 (US 10) and I had to go with a 42 in these shoes. Even with one full size down, I feel like they have stretched a bit too much after about 15 pitches. Next time I would consider going down to a 41.5 .Regardless, great all day shoe for any style of climbing... especially long multipitch routes.
review.name: Great all around performance

review.reviewBody: First pair of climbing shoes after renting all the time. I love the shoes. Just wish I wouldâ€™ve gotten a Velcro strap version as taking them on and off with the laces can be kind of cumbersome.
review.name: First pair

name: Finale Climbing Shoe

The boots are really stiff and appear to be a good quality. I normally wear a size 14.
 I ordered a size 15 just to be safe and my toes were still jammed into the toe box. I could not believe how small these boots were. I had to double check the actual size tag several times, because my other boots that are size 14 were actually larger.

review.reviewBody: It's lighter than most chairs and comes at a great price. there are more comfortable and lighter chairs out there but they are more than twice the price of this one.
review.name: good little chair.

review.reviewBody: For some background, I am 74, and I am in very good physical condition considering I've dealt with a hemispherical spinal cord injury affecting my right side partially paralyzing my right leg, arm and hand and weakening the right side of my core for 32 years.  I bought the chair so I could remove my shoes and other garments allowing me to get into my tent without dragging dirt, sand, mud, etc. into the tent.  This chair is great.  It's light and compact when folded.  It's easy to assemble, even by me while mostly using my left hand.  It feels sturdy to sit in and stable, and it is quite comfortable.  Also it is high enough to easily get in and out of.  I don't feel as though I'm going to tip or fall out.  The feet are designed to work on both hard and soft surfaces and they do that well.  Remarkably it is easy to disassemble and pack in the provided bag as well.  In short, it's a great chair.
review.name: Well designed, easy to use, comfortable

name: Joey Camp Chair

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the compression, the sexy satin black shorts are super flattering! As far as padding goes, I think that is a matter of preference. In my opinion, the padding in these shorts are exceptional! Have worn these extensively from 20 to 65+ miles and they have held up well and never disappoint on comfort. I?ve paid $200 for less padded shorts that leave me in an awful way down there. I?m about to order these shorts for a third time. Wore my first pair out. Second pair is holding up great after several months. It protects my parts even in aero position! Hands down my favorite cycling shorts :-)
review.name: Always come back to these!

review.reviewBody: Yes these shorts have padding very supportive when cycling long distance.
review.name: Love these shorts

review.reviewBody: Fit was fine, padding under the rear was great but it was very, very thick through the crotch and front. Pad extended too high. Like the other review, feels like wearing a diaper.

review.reviewBody: I've always had excellent sunglasses--meaning superb optical performance registering the scene in front of me AND I liked the way I looked wearing them. I keep my sunglasses until they can't be repaired or I lose them. My last pair, Maui Jim's, I had for seven years, so I was kinda giddy when I lost them. I looked around and chose the Smith Embark. I have other Smith products so was confident they'd be excellent. And they are. At any elevation they make the world a better looking place (and I like how I look :-). But I just lost a side shield and am looking for a replacement. Anyone out there know where I can get one? My only recommendation is for Smith to give you two sets. May be a mea culpa on their part, but it also would be a good look, lookin' out for their customers who buy their expensive stuff. You read these reviews, Smith? Where can I get a replacement side shield?
review.name: excellent, but the side shields can fall off and I want to get a replacement...

review.reviewBody:
These glasses have great lenses. However the build quality is subpar. They feel extremely cheap. They creak and groan unfolding them and moving them around.

For the price, I expect a way better build quality. This will most likely be my first and last purchase of Smith sunglasses.
review.name: Smith embark

review.reviewBody: They took a little getting used to since they have fairly full coverage, but I've grown to love them and wear them almost every time I'm in the mountains. I've been more sensitive to glare from my peripheral vision, these have helped immensely to reduce it. I wear them hiking, skiing, mountain biking and on the water.
review.name: Favorite New Shades

review.reviewBody: Everything about these glasses is great, except the inner lense. Another reviewer mentioned it but I still figured I would give them a try. As they said, impossible to clean without soap and water.
review.name: Sticky inner lense is a problem

review.reviewBody: The lens is perfect for me. Not to dark. Can use it in cloudy days. Good protection/ good vision
review.name: The lens is perfect for

review.reviewBody:
Ordered a pair to try them out in the Matte Black + ChromaPop Glacier Photochromic Copper Blue Mirror Lens. Liked them so much I just ordered 3 more pairs for all my kit bags so I never forget them. 
Iâ€™m out in the back country, skiing and snowshoeing a month strait during the winter in the Sierra Nevadas and these glasses have held up great with constant abuse.
review.name: Awesome glasses

review.reviewBody: The hinges on the temples began to break through the plastic after two weeks of use. Smith does not seem interested in standing behind the quality of their products at all.
review.name: The hinges on the temples

review.reviewBody: Great under bright conditions. Takes longer than I'd like to transition for low light
review.name: Great under bright conditions. Takes

review.reviewBody: Great glasses for long days on the water, Iâ€™m a full-time fishing Captain and quality glasses are a mustâ€¦these âœ”ï¸ the box for sure.
review.name: Great glasses for long days

review.reviewBody: I really wish that the photochromic copper blue lens was polarized, it would make these ultimate freshwater fishing glasses. Polarized and photochromic in that vlt would be a game changer.
review.name: So close

name: Embark ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Worst sandals Iâ€™ve ever owned. Gigantic buckles rub holes in the top of your foot. Such a goofy illogical design m. Idk who approved it but they need to be transferred to a new department or let go.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve been guiding whitewater for 20 years and have used many different types of footwear from shoes to sandals and these are the best all-around whitewater sandals. The grip is perfect on slippery rocks, and the thwart pad makes is easy to wedge your foot under the thwarts. You have the freedom of a sandal with the fit of a shoe.
review.name: Great Whitewater Sandal

review.reviewBody: The buckles are too big. There is no floatation. The clasp gives me blisters. The sole is slippery. I was excited but disappointed in the end.
review.name: PFD Sandals

review.reviewBody: These sandals have a great, hard, grippy sole. As someone that prefers a barefoot feel out of both sandals and shoes, these weren't necessarily my infinite favorite - but that's not Astral's fault, that's just a personal preference. The only reason I gave it less than 5 stars is because the buckles over the foot bed are kind of...large, and the imprint of the foot was much shorter than where my actual forefeet sit, so the little ridge between the forefeet and the toes that keeps your foot from sliding forward/backwards actually sits closer to the back of my forefeet when I have the sandals buckled.
review.name: Fear Not The Rocky Shores

review.reviewBody: Probably the worst product I've ever ever bought. Bought them for a long trip to Asia, and the buckle broke almost immediately. When I tried to fix it with the homemade buckle, the grooves on the inside of the shoe cut into my toe. Just a terrible product.
review.name: bad - stay away

review.reviewBody: Really nice sandals, I'd say they were perfect if the the forefoot area was much wider. I ended up going 2 sizes up to make it work, but they are worth it. If there was a way to make the heel strap less floppy in jandal mode that would be deluxe. Grip is bomber which is what most sandals lack
review.name: Excellent but very narrow

review.reviewBody: the sandals are great   BUT. in my case I have found them to be too narrow ...even a half inch wider would make them perfectly comfortable
review.name: a little wider  PLEASE

review.reviewBody: These sandals are awesome!  As advertised and ready for your adventures!
review.name: Great !

review.reviewBody: It is my go to sandal on and off the river; I have 2 pairs for this season, I only wish it was easier to attach the heel strap.  They are secure once I am able to get it attached.
review.name: Go to sandal

review.reviewBody: In the interest of keeping it short and honest, I was highly skeptical when I read the reviews prior to purchasing.  How can a sandal feel so secure?  Let's just say that it delivers on all fronts.
review.name: Promises kept...

name: PFD Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: The whole Instinct line is phenomenal and this is my go-to shoe for any sport climb that requires putting all my weight on tiny foot holds. ! I have a high volume foot, medium-width toe box, and narrow heel. With the Instinct VS, VSR, & S(R), I've been wearing 43.5 and went up to 44 on the W Instinct. The other instinct models were slightly too tight at 43.5 and had too much space in a 44, but the W Instinct fits perfectly! Other brand size comparisons: Evolv Shaman- 10.5, La Sportiva Solution Comp- 42.5, Tenaya Ra- 10
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody:
These shoes are actually the Women's Instinct Lace-up and not the VS's pictured. 
The fit is about the same as the VS, but with more ability to adjust for comfort or performance. The heel is a little different, but the performance was great on a trip to Joshua Tree. I placed my heel on a small protrusion and the it didn't budge as moved I moved my hands to some small crimps. I wouldn't recommend these for smearing out of the box, but for aggressive overhanging climbs and small foot chips, it's a champ.

My shoe sizes:
Scarpa Instincts (VS, VSR, SR, and Women's VS) 39.5
Madrock Remora size 6.5
Unparallel Vim/Regulus 7.5
review.name: Performance Lace-up

name: Instinct Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Iâ€™ve only been able to use these a couple times but overall Iâ€™d say they are super comfortable and durable. I wore them once all day in nature and I will say I was surprised how well they supported. No pain. Definitely recommend
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had high hopes for this boot. A waterproof boot going into Winter? Yes! I am all over that. I was very disappointed once I got these home and actually wore them on a hard surface. It was as if I had strapped on 2 X 4s. I kept wearing them for a week-10 days until I developed a hip issue, which has gone away once I stopped wearing them.
review.name: Hip pain

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Sturdy and great arch support. Haven't tested its waterproofness. Fit perfectly with a thin sock, If you want to use padded socks, go up a size.
review.name: Great ankle support

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love that these are waterproof, and comfortable even with a tougher exterior, I'm a loyal Keen customer because their shoes last FOREVER they're worth the price.

Note: I did have to size half a size down than my original size and it fits perfect, plus they kind of stretch and mold to your feet after a while
review.name: Perfect for the PNW and my Barista job

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought my usual size that I always wear in both Keen and other brands of boots. Wore them on a hike and realized they are a half size too small. My toes painfully hit the end of the boot going downhill. Never had this happen before in this size, and itâ€™s especially weird as all the other reviews say they run large. Keen quality and sizing seem to be getting more and more inconsistent. Unfortunately they are not eligible for a return since they are a warranty replacement
review.name: Inconsistent sizing

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great comfort and grip. I love that this boot runs wide since I have wide feet and I wear orthodics. This is my 2nd pair of Keenâ€™s.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the boots but they are huge and I canâ€™t wear them. They feel like a 9, not an 8.5. Iâ€™m so disappointed, and out the cost of these boots. Keenâ€™s have been unreliable lately. They used to be my favorite shoes for years and years and years. Iâ€™m bummed but I have to quit you, Keen. Too expensive a mistake has been made once again.
review.name: Unreliable Sizing

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: As always Keen comes through for me. Even my picky husband was convinced. We researched and tried on all sorts of hiking boots. Took a risk at ordering on your website, as we couldn't try them on, (especially my picky husband). They came and like in Cinderella they were the perfect fit. No princess and the pea issues. True to size, went for a hike right away and no slippage on the heels, no blisters. So comfy. I have worn Keen shoes before and they have rescued me with my plantars fasciitis for years.
review.name: Like a glove

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots were comfortable out of the box, but after a short 3 mile hike, I had a bruise on my leg. Iâ€™ve never had that happen with boots before.
review.name: Bruised my leg

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have loved my targhee IIIâ€™s as they had a comfortable footbed and felt good to hike in but this newer version is comfy, tightly waterproof and harms been designed to not delaminate.
review.name: Comfy and waterproof

name: Targhee IV Mid WP Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.name: ME502 Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano ME502 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These mountain bike shoes are the best. They are something like slipping on your favorite slippers while drinking a whiskey. Just perfect. Took them for a ride today. They are awesome. I swear they make me faster. Took me a little while to understand the release on BOA dial but once I figured out that you can pull it up and everything releases, life got good again. These MTB shoes are the best. True to size and so supple on your feet. Totally happy with the purchase.  Happy Trails!
review.name: Best MTB Shoes Ever

review.reviewBody: I wear a 10.5 shoe and bought these in a size 44.  I'm not a bike shoe connoisseur and have on only owned other Shimano mtb shoes and a couple of Giro pairs. Just bought a second pair of these as I like them the best and worry they will be discontinued or replaced with a new design I won't like as much. BOA system is easy and quick to use to get a snug fit. Shoe is stiff enough for me for on the bike but still provides good hike a bike traction and comfort when needed.  They are not super light nor heavy. Other Shimano shoes I have had in the past have had a highly ventilated mesh toe box which leads to wet socks/feet even with minor creek crossings. Not so with these as are fairly closed in toe area but is still breathable.  I recommend them as an all round great recreational trail and XC riding shoe.
review.name: Great for rec. trail and XC riding.

review.reviewBody:
These shoes are going into the parts bin. After a full season, I've come to the conclusion that these shoes suck. Shimano, why did you think a wire (boa) across the top of the foot and over such a thin tongue material would work, I have no idea. But no matter what, these shoes are uncomfortable. Leave them too loose and your heal pulls up, no support, etc. Tighten them up, and you have a miserable hot spot on the top of you foot that causes cramps. 

Shimano appears to also have changed sizing recently. Shimano 45/10.5 US used to be good for me. Not in this shimano shoe. If you read this review and still want to try them out, I'd suggest going with the smaller size if you are on the fence. 

So I'm back in the shoe market already again, all I know is I'm done wearing these painful SH-ME5 foot killers.
review.name: Disappointing Shimano Shoe

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable shoes that I've ever had for mountain biking. They seem very sturdy built. They have good traction in the event you have to scout an obstacle as well! I'd buy them again
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great fit and solid feel. The Boa lacing system makes it easy to tighten or loosen as needed. I normally wear wide shoes but these fit just fine. I only ride for about an hour or so at a time so I can't attest to long term comfort but so far they've been great.
review.name: Comfortable and stylish
comment: Note that L6 is not a dual boa so it only tightens and does not loosen. To loosen you would have to "release" (pull up) and then tighten to desired tension. I think the comment above is a little misleading.

review.reviewBody:
Over the years, I've found that most Shimano shoes fit my somewhat narrow, low-volume feet better than any other brand I've tried. I've only got a few miles on these, but I'm very impressed with the design of these shoes for general XC/Trail use. They have a much more precise fit compared to the previous generation M-501 (which fit like a boat) - very close to Shimano's old M-089 and M-163 - with a fairly tight toebox. You duck-footed guys should probably look elsewhere. I wear a 48 in all Shimano shoes - these fit my size 13 foot perfectly. 
They have great rigidity while stomping the pedals (I'm 6'5", 215#), but they're very comfortable. The BOA is super easy to use, and offers impressive comfort for how precise the fit is. Hike-a-bike sections are no problem - great traction with no heel slippage. They work seamlessly with Time ATAC cleats & Special 8 pedals - easy in & out. 
They're quite a bit lighter than my AM901s, almost like a full-on XC shoe, but they've got reinforcements to ward of moderate abuse, and super grippy rubber soles. I think this shoe would work really well for racing or endurance events. These are my new favorite trail shoes - the perfect balance of comfort, weight, and protection for general XC/Trail use.
One caveat - I hope the "new" rubber outsole design stays intact better than Shimano's previous trail shoes. I've had a pair of M-089s and M-163s that both peeled the outsole away from the midsole while hike-a-biking in rough terrain. While I loved those shoes, I had to trash them - super disappointed!
review.name: Excellent Daily XC/Trail Shoe!

name: ME502 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Primaloft100 Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have an Arc'teryx Atom and was looking for something with a little more insulation for colder days. This jacket is perfect for that. Love the extra pockets. The only downside, are the arms, they seem to be a tad long for me. I fit in a medium perfectly and the arms wouldn't be long. I feel like I am in-between both sizes.  I went with large because it was slightly bigger but the downside are the arms, they are a little long for me but I wanted more mobility.
review.name: Great Jacket!!/ Only one downside for me

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Primaloft100 Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Does everything you want it too and looks so good. 
It's very warm and with the two chest pockets it hits it out of the park. 
It's got good coverage too with the long length.  
The fit is really on point, there is plenty of room for layers. It's not a 
slim Norrona cut. 

I have the Arcteryx Nuclei AR (actually I had two, but sold one) which has
been one of my all time favorite jackets and when I saw this I was thinking
this is the Nuclei but with two chest pockets which makes it way way more 
functional!!  It's warmer than the Nuclei too. 

Just buy it.
review.name: Phenomenal Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Trollveggen Primaloft100 Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The photo is a little misleading as the model is wearing a hoodie (trollveggen
Powerstretch Pro Zip Hood) underneath which has thumbholes (matching the coat perfectly).

This had all the features I was looking for but no thumbs, I would have kept this except I was looking for a coat with a cuff that has thumbholes.
- I love the long back hem
- the two sided zipper
- multiple front pockets
- packable
- hood is spacious for a helmet

I found the fit Large to be comfortable and spacious, not bulky, I could have fit in a medium as well I think, but was looking for the mobility.
review.name: Immediately warm but no thumbholes

name: Trollveggen Primaloft100 Full-Zip Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Britt X Ultra Light Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This is my 7th or 8th attempt to find a dovetail pant that works.
I'm a 30.5in waist, 39in hip, and I lift, I have thick thighs. I own the britt in canvas in size 10, waist is a bit too big, but the thighs were so tight I cut them into shorts.
Then I found the stretch denim Britt in size 8, and they're almost perfect except for summer.
These are it! Idk what color the reviewer who says they're snug, but I got the green ripstop in 8, and they stretched with a day of wear to need a belt for me.
I have knee pads in them, I wear them for landscaping. I bought a second pair with my next paycheck.
I surprise bled into them, and was able to use water and a paper towel to blot the blood out in my work bathroom. This material is amazing.

I've had them for about 3 weeks and worn them for every work day so far.
I finally found a dovetail pant that makes me like their brand as much as I've been wanting to (please y'all, bigger thighs in the canvas pants, I'm a GD powerlifter, and am so annoyed their thicker pants DO NOT fit my dovetail booty and power thighs. Ugh).
Anyway, THESE pants though, are legit.
Don't get them! I don't need the competition.ðŸ˜…
review.name: Pants I been waiting for

review.itemreviewed: Britt X Ultra Light Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the functionality of these pants but the fit is not ideal. I got these for work pants, so I was disappointed to find the rise is so low that I have to be careful about plumbers crack. Also, I usually wear a solid 10 but had to return the 10s for a 12, which is still a pretty snug fit. I donâ€™t own a single other pair of 12 pants so itâ€™s def a sizing issue. I want to love them!
review.name: Fits tight, very low rise. Great pockets

name: Britt X Ultra Light Pant - Women's

hasVariant.name: Zero Series Fly Reel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Redington Zero Series Fly Reel online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The reel broke after 2 months of use.  Redingtonâ€™s warranty replacement lead time is quoted at 3-4 MONTHS. Poor product and poor customer service. I canâ€™t recommend.
review.name: Reel broke after 2 months of use

review.reviewBody: I bought this reel to pair with my new 7' 6" 3wt for smaller/tighter stretches of water. After having the chance to take it out on a few outings, I have fallen in love with this thing. It absolutely serves the purpose of a great small water reel. I will say, it did take some adjustment to get used to not having any drag, but it makes fighting those small stream cutties so fun! I probably wouldn't put it on anything larger than a 4 weight, but it's a great option for a backcountry or small water set up.
review.name: It's the little things in life...

name: Zero Series Fly Reel

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Frontier UL Cutlery 3-Piece Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Frontier UL Cutlery 3-Piece Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Frontier UL Cutlery 3-Piece Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have these in my backpack and use them with lunch everyday at work. Super lightweight and easy to use. I had the plastic ones before and those ones were awesome as well but since I use them everyday I wanted to have something metal. Canâ€™t wait to use them on a backpacking trip.
review.name: Light weight and perfect

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice set, but the fork is just too lightweight to the point of being flimsy and easily bent when cutting/eating meat.
I get the desire for light weight, but a few notches up from a plastic fork is not what a camper needs.
Iâ€™ve already bent the fork I was sent, and it was a replacement for an earlier more substantial fork. Five stars for the knife and spoon!
review.name: Beef ðŸ¥© Up the Fork!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was such a handy cutlery set. I love that it comes with a carabiner to keep the set together. Theyâ€™re sturdy and get the job done. I Recommend!
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I thought these were really nice. They are durable so they wonâ€™t break or bend. Easy to clean. They can be used inside or if you go camping:, outside. I like they fit on that carabiner it makes it easy to travel with and keeps all of them together.
review.name: Versatile and durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Being prepared in all situations is something that I like to always be. This camping Cutlery set is strong, has great material, and you can carry around in your waist belt.
review.name: Awesome to have!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love that this set has a nice hook to keep them all together. Cleaning was super easy. Being made from Aluminum is the only downfall. Bends super easy. Wouldnâ€™t waste my money.
review.name: Not worth the price!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this cutlery set. It is easy to take wow hiking camping kayaking or even into the office for lunch. It is not dishwasher safe. It is very durable made of aircraft aluminum alloy. It is super lightweight, and I love that. It comes with a carabiner.
review.name: Wow!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this for free for a honest review. Iâ€™m so glad I had chance to try out this Ultralight Cutlery Set out .I go camping sometimes and this set will be great to take with me and will be a lot lighter than taking my usual set so it want take up as much space in my bag .This set will be great  to take hiking ,on a picnic, or just keep a set in an emergency bag. They are nothing like eating with plastic they are BPA,PFDA, PTFE FREE.. I will definitely have to buy 2 more sets for my family . This set also has a carabiner to help keep them together a you can also hang it wherever you need to ..
review.name: Very Convenient Culery Set

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wish I could give this Sea to Summit Frontier Cutlery Set more than 5 stars because it is exceptionally designed and made. 

First, it is incredibly light and would make a convenient addition to any camping pack. I could barely notice the weight at all, which makes a huge difference when you have so much to carry. 

Second, the design of this cutlery is brilliant. It is very thin and stackable so it takes up a very small amount of space. It also comes with a carabiner so that all the pieces stay together and you can hang it from your pack. This is such a nice bonus and still adds very little weight. 

Third, I love that this is made with durable aluminum so that it is strong enough for the toughest of hiking trips, but is still light. The edges are smooth and itâ€™s very tough. 

Overall, this cutler set is sleek and easy to use. The design team really thought of everything with this one and Iâ€™ve already bought another set for my boyfriend. We are excited for our next hike and to keep using this cool new product. Highly recommend!!!
review.name: Convenient, Durable, and Light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these camping silver wear these feel so comfortable in my hands and they are very durable and I love the quality of them I would definitely recommend these and they are portable and easy to clean ï¿¼
review.name: Best camping silverware

name: Frontier UL Cutlery 3-Piece Set

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it! Finally, a pack that fits properly and works great! Lots of divided sections and now I can actually use the waist pockets bc they reach around all the way. It's awesome to have a pack designed for not just for skinny folks!
review.name: Love it! Finally, a pack

review.reviewBody:
This is the perfect daypack for larger folks, even though it's maybe a bit bigger than I need for most dayhikes.

The waistband actually fits me (none of the regular models do (sz 50w) and the general fit is super comfortable. The side pouch is a bit small but I'm still able to fit my iPhone 14 Pro Max inside. The water pouch on the outside is a so-so decision IMO but the back doesn't end up pushing on me too much with a 2L bladder inside.

Exterior material feels heavy duty and the zippers inspire confidence. 

I'll update this review if I experience any issues with it.
review.name: Love the new extended fit model - comfy

review.reviewBody: I just love, love, this suit. Color are super cool. This suit is so comfy!!
review.name: My Gorgeous shorty

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like this suit because it fit well (I bought size M and I'm about 5'6''/145 lbs with a longer torso), the material is soft and the full coverage bottom was ideal and comfortable for me. That said, however, I could not wear this - even dry - without my full nipples being visible through it. I did not heed the reviews about no liner because I don't particularly need support, but with the white color and no liner, I can't imagine anything would be left to the imagination if I was to actually use this in the water. So, sadly, back it goes. Also, the top stripes are more beige and the bottom is gold so the color combo was a bit different than what I imagined from this picture.
review.name: No liner

name: Lido One-Piece Swimsuit - Women's

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve used this bag multiple times during both day hikes and as a personal item while flying. When empty, itâ€™s so light and packable, that I will even stow it in the bottom of a carry-on bag just to have an option of having a backpack during day adventures once I get to my destination. Iâ€™m planning on packing this onto my carry-on as another backpack option on my honeymoon to Europe. Itâ€™s a no brainer when it comes to having the ability to bring a backpack on a trip without sacrificing on space and weight. I highly recommend this backpack for short day hikes as well as it weighs next to nothing, but can hold a surprising amount of gear in a way that is close to your body while still being comfortable.
review.name: Very Convenient & Packable

name: Aenergy 12L Daypack

hasVariant.name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a wonderful sleeping bag to be used during cold temps. Handled single digits well. I used the reactor liner with this bag. I am very impressed with the quality and packability of this version. Would order again!
review.name: This is a wonderful sleeping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag was super easy to set up. Felt like I was in a cocoon throughout the night. Wish breathability was better. Idk how butterflies survive if thats what it feels like!
review.name: Hefty

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this sleeping bag. I am a side sleeper who likes their feet out. This bag meets these needs and goes with me everywhere I go. I sleep on my left side, the men's version is the way for me.
review.name: Side sleeper in sleep heaven

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very durable sleeping bag. It also helps keep your body temperature regulated so youâ€™re not cold or super hot. I love the versatility of it and the packability of it.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is warm! Itâ€™s down filled. Can accommodate a person up to six feet. You can hook 2 sleeping bags together to make a double sleeper. Light weight. Not as constricting as some other mummy bags. Definitely a great find.
review.name: Warmth and comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't wait to use this camping! This is a very nice quality down sleeping bag. It's comfortable and roomy and is rated to keep you warm down to 15 degrees! The down didn't poke through the fabric and the zippers worked nicely. My only issue is that one of zippers seems to need fixed as noted in one of the pictures. I like that it came with both a storage cube so the down doesn't get deflated in storage but it also has a travel bag for your trips!
review.name: Good quality sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable sleeping bag with a really good design to keep the zipper from breaking. Warm and more comfortable than most. Beautiful color and had multiple bag sizes to choose from.
review.name: Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag is really nice!  Itâ€™s super lightweight but keeps you warm!  The zippers are a little odd with them over lapping.  It comes with a nice bag to put it in to store away!
review.name: Great lightweight sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The package quality is next to none- the quality of the sleeping bag feels like a sleeping mat built into the sleeping bag.

Also comes with a user manual and a sleeping pouch container to hold the sleeping bag. 

Using it for last 1 month 

3 things that stood out 
1. Feels like I'm sleeping on a could, sleeping bag comes with a comfort padding and not just a bag with cheap/useless materials. 
2. Quality control is superb, company makes sure products are correct and very attention to detail. 
3. Overall the retention of heat is appearant and the product holds to its standard
review.name: Top of the line product that wont disappoint

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is a dream! I'm so excited to use it while camping. Its so soft, extremely lightweight and super warm and comfortable. It has durable zippers and closures.  Opens from the top, side, AND bottom. Which is great for people like me who don't like their feet enclosed. I love down filled and knew right away I was going to fall in love with this sleeping bag. It even has a closure to tighten up around your enclosed head. Complete protection and warmth!
review.name: In love!

name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.reviewBody:
The valve is great, which is why I ended up getting an insulated bottle. Great flow, got used to it pretty quick, and so far easy to keep clean. Only got water up my nose a few times. overall 5 stars on the valve design for now. 

The raw aluminum doesn't insulate at all. If there's sun out and it's a warm day, the bottle will heat up the water super fast. If it's a hot day, you might as well make tea or hot chocolate with the water, cause it gets hot. Simply said, don't expect this bottle to keep anything warm or cold. I should have known better myself, but still was surprised at how thin the bottle was. Oh well.  

Save yourself the trouble, and get the insulated version.
review.name: Raw aluminum poor - Valve is Great

name: Bivo One 21oz Non-Insulated Bottle

review.reviewBody: The most lightweight comfortable fabric for warm conditions outside & indoors. Hiking, camping, summer fun, working out, long hospital shifts etc. Super quick dry. Great for travel. I own several & would love to see more blue & teal shades released. Highly recommend :)
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Itâ€™s really light weight and quick dry. Think, but not see through. Love the green color and order the red color too. Great fit,  small size fit perfect, I am 5 ft and 115 lb.
review.name: Light weight and quick dry

review.reviewBody: I like the v-neck style and fit true to size. Lightweight and nice color (I have light blue). Will also likely use for running and sports but bought for backpacking.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody: Body length runs a bit long on 5â€™3â€ frame. Very lightweight fabric but not see-through. Trim fit but not tightâ€”went with a small (for reference, 125lbs and 32DD). Like the slight v-neck and princess seams for shape.
review.name: Ultralight fabric, trim fit

review.reviewBody: Love love love this shirt. It's lightweight and great for summer or as a baselayer in fall/spring. Unlike most shirts that hit on my upper hip/waist, this one falls at mid-hip, making it flattering and letting me raise my arms without showing skin. I use it for running and hiking and it dries quickly - it's thin but not transparent. I've bought multiple ones!
review.name: Perfect shirt, absolutely perfect

review.reviewBody: Love this shirt. It's tunic length and the cut is flattering - it goes under my hiking backpack waist strap but not too long. Very lightweight and dries quickly. I use it for hiking and biking - recommend it highly.
review.name: Perfect shirt

review.reviewBody: This is my all-time favorite shirt for any hot and active days. Washes and dries so quickly and doesn't hold odors.
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: Great all around shirt. Used for workouts and hiking. Material appeared to be see through however it was not! Great design. Wicks sweat, stays cool.
review.name: My new everyday T

review.reviewBody: I bought the long sleeve version of this shirt last year and was excited to see it offered in a short sleeve version. It is very light weight and comfortable. The sizing is just right - flattering but not tight or restricting. I love wearing it for walking, working out and looks good with jeans just hanging out.
review.name: Love the color, weight and sizing of this shirt

review.reviewBody: Great fit, good for casual wear or working out.
review.name: women's echo T-shirt

name: Echo Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband bc he canâ€™t keep his hands off my legs. I was hoping they would be just as soft as the leggings for women and they are the softness is the same!! Score! He absolutely loves them. They wash well and always look new. Heâ€™s a 5â€™9 wearing an XL size and they are the same waist size as joggers by other brands. He will eventually end up buying every color. He is now a Beyond Yoga believer and has two pairs of these!

review.reviewBody: he was suprirsed how comfy and had been hesitant to wear this younger style but think he will ebvently outof th house

review.reviewBody:
I had to get a large, short.  Doing squats and working out made the thighs to tight for last season's medium.
They are my go to bibs for ice climbing and teaching skiing on the rain days. Pertex  is lighter and better than the new gore stuff.
Ilike the big chest pocket and the beacon clip

Would like to have full length zippers!
review.name: great for bird legs

review.reviewBody: Seem like good bibs, a bit on the thin side so may tear but have held up well so far this season
review.name: Nice bibs

review.reviewBody: Wore it for the first time last week and it worked really well! The length was perfect and the features were great!
review.name: Great bibs

review.reviewBody: Go big or donâ€™t order. I ordered based of my size which would have been a medium. They are not even close to fitting. Way too small.
review.name: Size chart is awful.

review.reviewBody: Amazingly lightweight and breathable. Huge pocket on the front which fits both my wallet and phone. The new goretex material is holding up just as well as it used to.

I'm a resort rider who typically heads right to the back bowls and tree runs. These were my first pair of bibs and are now my default bottoms from start to finish of the season. Warmer through the core than I thought they'd be, with plenty of pocket volume and good locations. Plus, the zipper fly is a very convenient feature. All around superb pair of bibs.
review.name: Never had a bad day on the mountain in these bibs

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality and more than reasonable price, customer service is also phenomenal - had to return ones as medium size was a bit tight in the thighs and got large instead - large fits great (only wish they would be a touch longer) but once again very happy with the product
review.name: Very Happy with the bibs

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'6", 160lbs and the Medium-Short is a perfect fit. The material is lightweight, durable, and stretches in the right places. Not too baggy, not to snug. The side-entry bib is easy to get into, and I really appreciate the regular zip-fly for bathroom breaks. Leg and chest pockets are well placed and deep. The interior beacon leash and pouch are perfect for a phone. OR makes great gear. I really appreciate the attention to detail and availability of sizes
review.name: Great fit and function!

review.reviewBody: I got these bibs using a warranty credit for a pair of ski pants of the same weight. Unfortunately the pants had been discontinued so the closest thing that was available was this model of bibs. Pros: I've been skiing in them for a couple of months now at Steamboat. They are quite comfortable and dry with a polartec powerstretch fleece base layer under them. They are well constructed of quality materials. The pockets are deep and easy to access. Cons: 1. I really hate the side zip entry: a. It makes the bibs quite awkward to put on - the zipper is hard to reach with either hand. b. It requires unfastening one of the suspender straps and the buckles are difficult to fasten. c. It prevents you from ventilating and cooling off by opening zippers on your mid and base layer tops 2. The zipper fly is too short - it is difficult to do your business through this fly. 3. Lacks adequate pockets - one or two mid-thigh cargo pockets would really help A front access zipper would be a major improvement: 1. It would make them much easier to put on and take off 2. It would facilitate bathroom breaks 3. It would facilitate ventilation 4. If these bibs had a front access zipper, I'd really like them. With the current side access zipper I just barely tolerate them. I'd like to see them made from a slightly heavier fabric.
review.name: Quality product - annoying features

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of large because that is what my waist size determined, but the only thing that fit was the waist. I do not have abnormally sized thighs for my height/weight and the thighs were so tight that I could only get the zipper up with nothing on underneath (not the goal of a shell pant). Chest was also very tight - I fit, but not comfortably. Finally, I was disappointed that at the price point that the zippers are not water resistant (just covered by flaps). Any comparable bibs at this price point have water resistant zippers on the vents and side entry zipper.
review.name: Do not rely on waist size, disappointing zippers

name: Carbide Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes a month ago after owning and loving my specialized mtb shoes previously. The shoes are light and easy to get on and off, but Iâ€™m disappointed that there is only one twist tightened instead of two. I canâ€™t get the shoes as tight as the need to be. My old shoes had the two of the old fashioned strip and latch tighteners, and I could always get the shoe as tight as i wanted. These new Recons seem like they are not going to be a durable either but they are lighter.
review.name: Recon 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoes

review.reviewBody: The shoes are looking great, comfortable, easy to walk in, have a good grip to surface, but they are too flexible and soft fir an effective power transfer. Will use them fir a recovery and social rides.
review.name: Too soft.

review.reviewBody: Shoes are comfortable & light.  Replacing a pair of Shimano's and it's been a while since I wore specialized shoes - I had always liked their comfort but had a few disappointments with durability.  So far happy with the comfort of these, and based on the last few pairs of other brands, it seems durability may not be so different.  I've struggled to find my right size over the years - it seems shoe sizes have gotten smaller, and I appreciate these had half size increments.  These had a little less room in the toe box than I'd hoped for but size seems about right - compared to my previous shoes, the toe box seems to be stiffer so I probably can't rely on stretching.   I use Time ATAC pedals, and the cleats are pretty protected by the sole lugs which is nice when walking around
review.name: Comfort & Style

review.reviewBody: I measured my foot 100 times and used the Specialized fit guide and the sizing was right.  I'm an 11 in Nike and ended up with a 44.5.  Super comfy shoes.  Easy to walk in the forefoot bends nicely.  The Boa adjusts back and forth which is nice.  Only slight negative is that it isn't a carbon sole so if you do stomp on the pedals you can feel the shoes flex.  But, that is as described.  I was wearing all carbon shoes prior so it was a little surprising.  May go to the Recon 3.0 eventually but for now these are nice and comfy.
review.name: Decent shoes!

name: Recon 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe

review.name: Arm sleeves

Hot and cold weather conditions
review.name: Zero freeze camo arm sleeves covers

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit snuggly makes it a bit difficult to take off but love it so far.
review.name: Sleeves

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Arm sleeve is a good length.  Snug fit. A bit difficult to take off.
review.name: Sleeve

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent product that material is Quality is second to other brands.
review.name: Comfortable and look Great !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for driving protection, can wera with anything and it doesnt slip
review.name: Amazing Sleeves!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are comfortable and easy to wear. I probably should have gotten black because the white stain really easily. Not really Columbiaâ€™s fault there. The L/XL was a little big for me but the S/M was too small. Guess Iâ€™m in between sizing on these.
review.name: Good quality but stain easily

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have some other pairs that are the typical one size fits all and they are just too tight for longer bike rides. I bought this columbia version because they had a L/XL size, which is great for those of us who aren't skinny. They are a tad long so I roll up the sleeves rather than wear over my hands. They actually made me feel cooler as the sweat starts wicking away. Great when you are starting to get too much sun but are too hot to put on a long sheet shirt or jacket.
review.name: These are comfortable

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Purchased sizes s/m and l/xl.  Do not go off of the sizing chart.  It is not accurate.  I have an approximate 12.5" bicep and the s/m are too small. I couldn't even fit the sleeves over my biceps.  Size l/xl fits great!  Fits snug but not anaconda-like constricting.  If I want to, I can even pull up the sleeves a bit to the middle of my forearm.

I Can't speak to any cooling effects as I have yet to wear outdoors, but I do have some Omni-Freeze tops and towels and they work pretty well, so I'm expecting the similar with these sleeves. 

I read one review about the thumbholes ripping.  I can see this happening.  Personally, it's not a concern, since I will not be using the thumbholes.  To minimize this from occurring, my recommendation is to fit the sleeves over your arms prior to using the thumbholes.  

The inside of the upper portion of the sleeves have a silicone-like ring on the inside for grip and to keep the sleeves from sliding down the arm.  I have a concern that this silicone-like ring material may cause irritation and/or a rash when using for long hour under hot and humid conditions.  Once I've used, I will update this review as to my findings if the website will allow for updating.
review.name: Sleeve sizing runs small.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got these sleeves to use while driving in Arizona's heat, and they have been great! I measure my arm to make sure of my size and I find the sleeves true to size and comfortable to wear they are not super tight either loose. Just give them a try!
review.name: Good aid to prevent sunburn while driving!

name: Freezer Zero II Arm Sleeve
