review.reviewBody: I purchased the Sun Black lens option of this product. I wore them on a blue bird spring day at Monarch Mountain. It was 41Â°f and the snow was shiny and reflective in many places. These goggles were absolutely phenomenal, they were perfect for direct sun and bright snow, I never had trouble seeing the fall line or observing future obstacles. I had actually worn them during a wind storm (walking my dog for several blocks) a few days prior to hitting the mountain, and even in cloudy/overcast skies it was phenomenal. I just wish it had a bit more peripheral view.
review.name: Almost perfect but amazing all around.

review.reviewBody:
For me, getting your eyewear dialed makes a huge difference when recreating and the Squad goggles and suite of replacement lenses make it super easy to do so. 
My solution was to buy squads and chose the lens that best fits your 'regular' conditions--usually mixed/mid light. Next, choose your preferred lenses for two other light scenarios (usually low-light/cloudy and sunny/bluebird and store them in a lens case. Based on conditions, swap lenses to match conditions. 
Swapping out lenses gets easier the more times you do it.
review.name: Great solution at a great price point

review.reviewBody: I really want to love these, but I will admit changing out the lenses is such a pain that I wish I wouldâ€™ve went with another goggle. Every time I do it I feel like the lens is going to break. The goggle otherwise functions well, looks cool, and has a nice fit but wish they wouldâ€™ve come up with a better system for the lens swap
review.name: Expected more

review.reviewBody: The fit was perfect with my helmet. The lenses were clear. I would recommend to anyone looking for a solid pair of goggles for snow activities!
review.name: The fit was perfect with

review.reviewBody: Love my Squad Smith Goggles! They fit great and I love the visibility! Love that I can wear them in lots of different lighting and skiing conditions. Very happy with them and how comfortable they r. I would definitely recommend them!:)
review.name: Love My Squad Goggles!

review.reviewBody: Very difficult to change lenses. Almost impossible.
review.name: Very difficult to change lenses.

review.reviewBody: I'm very happy with my new goggles they performed well in snow storms, fog, sunny days and overcast/cloudy days . The fit is a little tight and the was no room to loosen the strap, only tighten-up the strap, but
review.name: I'm very happy with my

review.reviewBody: The goggles look great canâ€™t wait to try them. I am very disappointed that they didnâ€™t come with any type of protection when not in use? Other pair I have purchased came with a sleeve for the extra lense as well as a protective sleeve for the goggles themselves. Expected better.
review.name: Missed the mark

review.reviewBody: A good goggle that gets the job done. I wish the foam was a bit softer but other than that they are great!
review.name: A good goggle that gets

review.reviewBody: They have been everything I hope they would be! Beautiful work, Smith!

review.reviewBody:
Have worn them daily for snowshoe, xc ski, even trail running.  Look great for walking around / every day wear as well.  Not yet tested in super wet conditions.

I'm usually a 32/33 waist and 34 length and the large fits great.
review.name: Awesome buy

review.reviewBody: Better than I expected.  Bought for snowshoeing and cold weather hikes.  Have worn with light long underwear.  Did the trick.  Just perfect in terms of fit and feel.  Can?t say enough about them.
review.name: Love ?em

review.reviewBody: Bought the pants for an ice climbing trip in the PNW.  The fit at the waist was good and easy to adjust.  The length was a little long for me, and a bit baggy at the bottom. They are very comfortable.  Hiking in with them was great did not overheat or sweat to much in them.  Protection against wind was great.  When it god cold they kept me warm.  They did not really work too well as a water repellant.  Water seemed to soak into them right away even just leaning against the ice.  When it rained they got drenched pretty fast.  Others on the trip had different soft shell pants that held up way better against the water, specially when it rained.
review.name: Comfortable but not water repellent

name: Falketind Flex1 Softshell Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Pretty disappointed with this boot. I had these boots custom fit and heat molded. I've found the stiffness of the boot when leaning into the boot is not nearly a 120 flex after having the shell heated. When pushing into the shin piece while skiing you can feel the top of the boot (above your feet) collapse in. I have very wide feet and cannot fit into any boot out of the box. I regret purchasing these boots.
review.name: Not Stiff After Heating Up Shell
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
(Take this review with a grain of salt, this is on my foot of this model the feel will be completely different for most people)

Iâ€™ve been using this boot for about 2 months and Iâ€™ve been loving it. Itâ€™s great for touring and on piest. However I have a vary small ankle and low calf so I hade a lot of vertical motion in the boot and Iâ€™m currently getting some vary vary mild shin bang from needing to looses the buckles. I fixed the vertical movement with a custom foot bed and a 4mm heel lift in the liner. Now I only feel it when doing a nose butter. That being said this boot impressed me in every other way from the flex to the range of motion the hike mode. This is a vary impressive boot.
review.name: Perfect hybrid boot

review.reviewBody: This is the 4th pair of Salomon ski boots I have owned.  Been skiing on various XMaxs for  years 10 years.....skiing 100+ days a season.  With each generation, Salomon boots get better and better.  The Shift Pro continues the improvement.  Great fit and sturdy as can be....well done Salomon!
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: I bought a few weeks ago. Love the weight for riding, love the stiffness and downhill performance, and so easy to go from walk to ride. A little to heavy for extended tours.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: I usually donâ€™t write reviews about products but this one deserves it. I equipped myself this year with a touring setup. I have armada arv 106 skis with shift bindings. I was looking for gear that I could use both in backcountry as well as in resort and I am very impressed with these boots. They are fairly light compare to other four buckle touring boots, they sit very close to your feet and they are super comfortable. The walking mode provides a good range of motion. Great boot overall!!
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Bought this boot hopefully to be the quiver killer - 4 buckle, resort worthy, pin compatible and lightweight. Super impressed with the ski-ability of the boot and the boot is impressively lightwight for a 4 buckle boot. Highly recommended!
review.name: Shift Pro Boot Review

name: Shift Pro 120 AT GW Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: I first got a similar sandal at a sporting goods store in the late 1990's but it was a men's size and leather. Those lasted me for about 6 years as a secondary shoe. I'm a size 9 medium in tennis shoes. I love these sandals because they are made to fit any width wide/narrow and tight/loose. It's a one size fit all YET I would be 1000% satisfied if you made these in leather please. Leather is year round weather, this material in blue is for my jeans in summer and of course the light color is for my summer shorts. Keep me posted on your upcoming leather projects please. Thank you!!!!
review.name: Second impression

review.reviewBody: I have had (and worn out) several of these sandals and I like how adjustable they are and how well they stay on my feet. However, this pair is slightly shorter than my previous one. If I had known, I would have ordered a half size larger.
review.name: A comfortable sandal that stays on well.

review.reviewBody: These sandals are my new favorites. They are comfortable and supportive and give me relief from plantar fasciitis pain. The straps hold my foot securely in the shoe with no sliding or shifting around. They are great for walking or daily casual wear.
review.name: My new favorite sandal

review.reviewBody: Love the way these sandals fit and all the great colors. I think I have at least six pairs. The sole is just the right height for me as I am older and feel wobbly on those tall ones.
review.name: Love This Style

review.reviewBody: This is the fourth pair of this style I have purchased in the last five years. I wear them all summer long and love them. I bought a different color just recently and when they arrived, I wore them for a full day but that night my heel was sore and i had a small cut. Tried wearing them with a bandage on my heel but unfortunately, I have to return them. Wearing my older worn sandals again. May try buying the color I have worn for the last 3 years. Black with gray. The new color is Bering Sea that doesn't work for me.
review.name: It cuts into my left heel

review.reviewBody: The Tirra is my favorite style. I wish more colors would go on sale, it the did, I would be able to buy more!!!
review.name: Love Tirra

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I wear a size 11 shoe, but have narrow feet, so get these in a size 10. Adjustable for width.
review.name: This is my sixth pair of Teva Tiera's. All different colors.

review.reviewBody: I can go from walking on the sidewalk, hiking trails to the ocean in the same shoe!! Also, I discovered that these sandals float right side up! I have several pairs in different colors. Great sandal for Tropical locations or water locations.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again!! I love Teva!

review.reviewBody: This was my third pair of Tevas. I have enjoyed the comfort and durability. I will definitely buy again.
review.name: Exceptional shoe

review.reviewBody: I have worn this style for years and have had many colors. The look nice with jeans, shorts, nicer clothes. And they're comfortable enough to wear all day and play tourist in, even on cobblestones.
review.name: Great shoe!

name: Tirra Sandal - Women's

description: Buy the Nite Ize Steelie Orbiter Vent Kit online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Steelie Orbiter Vent Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize Steelie Orbiter Vent Kit online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've had this product for 6-8 months now and I am generally happy with the product. I've had no issues with the vent grip slipping and the magnet is plenty strong enough for the 2 A series phones I've had while owning it. The only issue I've had is with the grip material that keeps the phone from slipping. The material is now deteriorating and becoming soft and gooey and is starting to leave a sticky residue on the metal plate. I would think that the material would have been tested to last at least a couple of years.
review.name: Excellent accessory except...
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to see that the Orbiter magnetic socket is starting to become faulty for you. Luckily, at Nite Ize we have a worry-free guarantee and would be happy to help get you a replacement Orbiter Socket free of charge. Just reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we can go through the guarantee with you.

review.reviewBody: The Steelie Orbiter Vent Kit is exactly what I wanted to hold my phone for driving instructions.  I had to attach it to my air vent upside down to make it secure, but it works just fine that way.  I bought one for myself about a month ago and purchased this one for a friend.
review.name: Steelie Orbiter Vent Kit

review.reviewBody: Read reviews of the vent clip not working properly. Those reviewers must be on something as this is one of the best phone holder products Iâ€™ve seen. Not only does it work perfectly, my vent clip is hard to remove. Maybe the other reviewers had extremely thin car vents, but for reference it holds onto the thin plastic hanger on the box with ease (with weight).
review.name: Perfect product

review.reviewBody: Vent clip will not hold my iPhone 13 Pro Max steady
review.name: Poor vent clip
comment: I am so sorry to hear that, I would love to talk more about why it is not holding up your phone. I would also be happy to help you get a replacement through our two-year Worry-Free Guarantee or troubleshoot the problem more via email. Please reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we would be happy to help you out.

review.reviewBody: Love it. Owned one...left in a rental... bought two more
review.name: SteelieÂ® OrbiterÂ® Vent Kit

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my car. Put up with it sliding out of the vent everytime I tried to pull my phone off for awhile, because it supports the phone well. Eventually got fed up and gave it to my husband, hoping it would work better in his car. No dice. Slides out every time he tries to pull his phone off of it too. The grip needs to be tighter.
review.name: Great idea, but..
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear the Vent Kit is not working for you. One way to overcome this issue is to hold the Steelie ball in place as you pull the magnet off. I know this can be an extra step, but the strength of the magnet is greater than the clamp in the vent. We also have two other kinds of mounts: one that adheres to the dashboard and one that suction cups to the windshield. If you would like, I would be happy to send out  one of these for you to try as a replacement for the vent mount that is not working for you.  Please contact Nite Ize customer service at info@niteize.com or from 8-5 M-F MST at 800.678.6483 for your replacement

All the best,

review.reviewBody: I'm loving my new orbiter! I have other Steelie products for my cell phone, but this is the best yet due to the low profile on the back of my phone. I keep leaving the magnetic socket in my Jeep though so I will likely buy another socket for in the house. Did I say I'm loving it?!
review.name: My latest Steelie purchase rocks!

review.reviewBody: Used the other model with the magnet with red dot attached to the phone, where it wouldnt lie flat on it's back, made it difficult to use phone screen while flat on a surface.  However, this design with the thin disc on the back is perfect!  Strong magnet, strong clamp to vent.  Best thing, when I change cars, or travel and rent cars, this can go with me!  It's the best I can really imagine...  I'm in sales, in the car a ton, so I have used many brands over the years...  Can't say enough positive things.
review.name: Best I can imagine...

review.reviewBody:
I've used the Orbiter model in my Highlander for over a year. My phone is  Galaxy S9 Plus with an Otterbox case
 I like that the metal plate is thin, stuck right on the Otterbox and has never come off. Also, I can adjust and rotate the Orbiter as needed.  I have referred friends who are amazed when they see me simply place my phone on the Orbiter and it stays long or short trips. I haven't had any problems.
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody: Got this as a gift from my kids. I love the idea but it simply won't hold tight enough in the vent. I've got a Samsung Galaxy S20 plus. It's not a heavy phone but I'm constantly having to readjust it.
review.name: Amazing idea but won't hold tight in vent.
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. It sounds like the clamping mechanism for the mount is defective. We would be happy to replace that for you, please contact Customer Service at info@niteize.com or 800.678.6483 M-F 8 AM â€“ 5 PM MST.

name: Steelie Orbiter Vent Kit

review.reviewBody:

Itâ€™s a good job I also ordered a new bite valve as I could see from the pic it was a different shape to my current one.

review.reviewBody: I have an older Osprey hydration bladder that has a cracked/leaky bite valve. I've purchased similar replacement valve sheaths in the past to fix this problem. The latest set of valve sheaths I purchased are much too small in diameter to fit my bite valve. At some point there was a design change and it seems they no longer sell replacement parts for the old model. They should add some type of designation to indicate these only work with the new design.

review.reviewBody: I like the ZX/1 a little better, but the pattern and fit are good. These make my toes happy and support my arches well. Now, I am ready to play.
review.name: Happy feet
comment: We love happy feet! Thanks for sharing Kris!

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals and wear them every day all summer. This is my second pair of this exact shore. Note to the wise: kids size four is womenâ€™s size 7
review.name: My second pair!
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Robin!

review.reviewBody: Fits well & looks good. Stylin with my colors. Workin on the Chaco Tan... love my CHACOS got the Tie Dyed Chacos
review.name: Feelin Groovy
comment: They look awesome! Happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Fits at least a size bigger than expected. The tie straps drag on the ground as a result so I need to tuck them in. That said, they are still very comfortable and the straps are durable. No itches or scratches, good arch support, easy to keep clean, good grippy soles.
review.name: Fits big, still comfortable
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Jennifer!

review.reviewBody: I like these shoes, they are very cute, but they gave me blisters on my toe area. Ouch
review.name: Blisters!
comment: We appreciate your feedback Peyton. We appreciate your feedback. Discomfort while breaking in your new shoes is never fun. We typically recommend breaking them in at a slow pace by wearing them 1-3 hours at a time in non-strenuous conditions to allow your feet time to adjust to them. Just as everyone's feet are a little different, this process can vary for different people. Also, click the following link to see how to adjust your sandals to get the perfect fit. https://tinyurl.com/4mxt6p9x

review.reviewBody: Great sandal!  My 4yo can easily slip them on and off!  These are his new favorite shoes!
review.name: Great sandal

review.reviewBody: defect product when received and unable to adjust to foot
review.name: defect product

review.reviewBody: My son is 5, so I think theyâ€™re just a learning curve for him. I wouldnâ€™t rate it a 4, but they were hard to adjust to a comfortable fit for him. However, I do think he needs to get used to this type of shoe, so I wouldnâ€™t prevent anyone from buying these, especially if your child is pretty easygoing in the footwear department. My guy is picky with shoes, socks, seams, and that kind of thing.
review.name: Great shoes, Iâ€™m sure my little guy will adjust

review.reviewBody: The jacket is beautiful. Why it gets 4 stars is because I always where a medium with plenty of room to wear sweaters under, and this jacket is tight around the shoulders and chest.

review.name: Returned
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our Women's Montreal Coat. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your feedback about the sizing to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Weâ€™re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM - 5PM EST. 

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

hasVariant.name: DND Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro DND Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: DND Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro DND Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: DND Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro DND Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my fifth pair. My first pair just started to become un-stitched after almost ten years! Had to buy more just in case they stop making them. I did lose a pair(some lucky person in Oakridge,Or has them now)
review.name: Best glovesâ€¦.hands down!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair. I love these gloves because they are tough and last. My first pair started to split a seam after 2 years of use - 2 seasons of racing, so these gloves were abused. The only down side is that you have to squeeze your hand in every time you put them on since there isnâ€™t a strap that closes at the wrist. Even with the small inconvenience I still love them.
review.name: My favorite gloves

review.reviewBody:
First off, I have relatively wide palms and short fingers, so most gloves give me that extra pooch at the finger tips.  However, I have had Fly Racing gloves that consistently give me plenty of palm width with zero pooch at the finger tips.

Knowing the competition, I consider these to be poor fit. I struggle to put it on, feels like I am going to rip the cuff (other gloves without the Velcro closure don't have this problem). Once they are on, the palms have a weird ripple on the ulnar aspect. The quality and padding seem quite good.  Other Giro gloves seem to have inconsistent sizing across the different models.
review.name: Too skinny

review.reviewBody: Medium size is like a small kid size. Material is thin, no wonder it is cheap.  Returned soon as I received it.
review.name: Too small and thin material

review.reviewBody: I'm on pair #2 of these gloves. The first pair was kind of a shot in the dark after years of failing specialized gloves. The first pair of these DND gloves lasted about 2 years and I originally bought them through Ibis Cycles because they matched my Ripmo (because I like to match my stuff). These gloves are very soft on the palm side and comfortable although over time they do toughen up. There is just enough padding on the heel of the palm to keep things comfy on longer rides. The back of the hand also breathes very well on hot days despite not being a ventilated mesh. The large fit my hand perfectly. No extra material at the fingertips, and no "webbed" fingers. The closure-free wrist is just big enough to get my hand through and feels fitted once the gloves are on. Normally I'm pretty tough on gloves so the fact that these are this comfortable, and have lasted longer than any other gloves I've had make these my favorite. The fact that they are also some of the more affordable gloves mean I will be recommending these to everyone.
review.name: It's all you need

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite pair of gloves for getting DND. No velcro, soft snot patch and touch screen compatible. They are a bit thicker/hotter but won't rip the first time the palm touches dirt. Own a few pairs.
review.name: One of the favorites

review.reviewBody: These gloves have an excellent, tight for with no extra slack. They have a good amount of stretch to them as well  which makes them super comfortable. They feel great on the handlebars and provide solid group even when my hands are very sweaty. I've fallen a few times with them now and they held up great and protected my hands. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great fit and bar feel

review.reviewBody: Love the glove, fits perfectly. Not sure how durable it is, as I have not used it long enough. I'd suggest to wash it before first ride.
review.name: Fits like a glove

review.reviewBody: I bought two pairs of these gloves. One for me and my brother. The sizing is accurate and the glove fits like a glove! There is no looseness or empty space in the glove and this allows me to have maximum feel of my bike grips. No matter how sweaty my hands have gotten, these have maintained grip on my handles. They also offer some abrasion protection. I fell a couple times in these and each time I have gotten away with no rash on my hands but rash on other unprotected parts of my body. The ventilation is also decent as there is some perforation, but I think it could be better. The reason I give 5 stars is because of the amazing fit, flexibility, and bar feel.
review.name: Best gloves at the price point IMO.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these gloves. I bought my first pair, which I still have and still use, at a bike shop about 6 years ago. I've been expanding my collection every year by adding a new pair or two. The fabric is comfortable and stretchy; tough but breathable. The leather palms offer great grip on all of the different grips I've used over the years. I've definitely used the nose wipe a time or two and it isn't bad. It isn't the softest but you can't expect a Kleenex on the side of your mountain bike glove. I definitely recommend these gloves. Make sure to follow the recommended washing instructions and don't just buy one pair and they'll last you miles and miles!
review.name: My Ride or Die Glove

name: DND Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great build quality. Easy to switch the batteries.
review.name: Great warm weather skiing gloves

review.reviewBody: These mitts are game changing for me! I have Reynaud's and can now enjoy a full day out skiing without losing my hands. I wear a medium along with a liner glove. I used them for two full seasons before the button broke, but OR has been fabulous with a warranty claim.
review.name: Game changing mitts

review.reviewBody:
Have used these gloves for a few months now. Was aware of the weird thumb, so bought xl (even though I'm m-l). It's still a problem. My wife has tried them on, she would be a s-m in men's, and we laugh about it a lot. Wondering what lizard, cough, I mean human, they used as the model. 

Joking aside, as soon as they fix the weird thumb, I'll get another pair. They are fantastic. I love the low tech, that it's just a button and not a phone app. And have been happy with the heat and battery life, so far. 

Please fix the thumb!!!
review.name: Great gloves... But not sure who for

review.reviewBody: Had these many years and got some for my family because mine are so great!  They are light, warm and the ability to control the heat is terrific!
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody:
I can not understand with all the feedback about the thumb fit why these guys have not fixed the issue,
The mit is either too tight to get on or gigantic.
review.name: horrible fit

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately my husband can't use them. The thumb pocket is too small.

Bought these a few years ago and have replaced the batteries several times now.  At the end of ski season last year one quit completely.  At the price point it is very upsetting they have not performed well at all.  Have recommended to many fellow ski instructors and now regret that decision.
Only had an opportunity to wear these once at the end of the season, but I was very happy with how they performed. Hands were nice and toasty. I wear a size 6.5 gloves and the smalls were perfect!
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: I had a previous version of the fingered gloves that had a nice wide adjustable cuff. Due to a malfunction in the on off button, I received a pair of the mittens through warranty (they no longer make the fingered version I had). The mittens are very comfortable, but very difficult to get on. The elastic cuff at the wrist is really tight as is the thumb space. From other reviews, I made the decision to upsize and still found the fit in these two areas to be tight. I will, however, finish by saying the warranty process was fantastic!!
review.name: Poor Fit

review.reviewBody: I made the mistake of saving a few bucks with a product from China. What a disaster. These heated mitts really delivery. The battery life is excellent. Touch the mitt to your face and you won't feel the heat because the heat stays in the mitt instead of escaping to the cold air. The fit is good. The thumb is a tiny bit snug but I like that. Would definitely buy again. The bad circulation in my hands makes these a necessity for a day on the slopes.
review.name: Really Work

name: Prevail Heated GORE-TEX Mitten

review.reviewBody:
Almost like a thin fleece sweater.
Nice a warm but owing to the quality material, still breathes well.
review.name: Great Longsleave

review.reviewBody: Run a bit big but carhart t always do? that said husband been wearing for years still luvs them but dont last nearly as long as they used to as they aren't as heavy as they used to be
review.name: Still great but lighter weight

review.reviewBody: This was the first time where the sleeves were too short.
Great shirt!  Very nice quality fabric and great color choices.  Washes very well too!  Will definitely buy more!
review.name: Awesome product/awesome price!  Not a tight fit but gives you a little extra room for working.

review.reviewBody: My husband insists on pockets. This T-shirt met his demands and more!
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody: The fit was great. The color Heather was very vibrant.
review.name: Christmas gift

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and soft fabric. Fit was as expected, not too loose but not too tight.
Shirt runs small . I bought same shirt at a different store fits great same exact shirt and size ?! Need to know how to send back

name: Workwear Pocket Long-Sleeve T-Shirt - Men's

hasVariant.name: C3 Short Finger Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the GOREWEAR C3 Short Finger Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
On my first ride with these gloves... I was caught in a spring rainstorm. The gloves held their grip well after being soaked. I was able to climb out of the saddle without fear of slipping off the bars. 

The gloves have a nice compressed fit. I didn't feel them move around on my hands at all. The C3's gloves seem to disappear and become like a new layer of protective skin for your palms. 

After multiple rides with these gloves, the fabric and stitching have held form. I would purchase again!
review.name: Great grip & road feel !

name: C3 Short Finger Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Je les adore ! Elles sont belles, chaudes et confortables en plus dâ€™avoir une bonne adhÃ©rance. Je les ai testÃ© par moins 15 dans 1 ou 2 centimÃ¨tres de neige et glace pendant 2 heures et mes sont restÃ©s bien au chaud et je nâ€™ai pas glissÃ©. Je les recommande !
review.name: Un bon achat

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not the quality I expect from Merrell. The inside of the tongue had sharp nylon of some kind.  I had ordered 2 pairs due to sizing, but will be returning both.
review.name: Not the Quality I expect from Merrell

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Uncomfortable fit at the ankle, rifting and punches. The overall fit is wide. The grip is good.
review.name: Fit is uncomfortable for a long excursion.

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have size 11 narrow feet so ordered the largest size, 11, while also being a littler nervous about fit based on other reviews. The width is great, the shoes are super comfy and I think will be perfect for travelling, however the shoes are probably half a size to small (my toes are at the end of the shoes). Since I canâ€™t exchange them for a larger size (there isnâ€™t one), I decided to keep them and will just see how it goes. Love the colour, feel, width, just wish they were a touch longer and didnâ€™t fit on the small side.
review.name: Fits a bit in the small side

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Shoe is extra, extra small. I ordered a half size larger than I usually do but I think I needed to bump up by a size and a half more potentially.
review.name: Cute, but not a proper fit.

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody:
La gance arriÃ¨re a arrachÃ© Ã  la premiÃ¨re utilisation. 
Sinon, les bottes sont confortables.
review.name: BrisÃ©e

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for a trip to Vermont in the fall. I wore them around town at home to break them in, no breaking in needed. Never had any blisters or pain. Were excellent on short hiking trails and walking downtown.
review.name: Great Multipurpose Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Had a pair years ago. Miss the 90â€™s.   Great for a day hike.  Very comfortable!
review.name: Love my Merrels.
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Jenny!

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe for a hiking trip in the Swiss Alps. I wore this shoe every day, in the rain, mud, mountains, even with my lederhosen at Octoberfest. They were warm, comfortable, and my socks never got wet despite walking in lots of rain.
review.name: Comfortable, durable, waterproof
comment: Thank you for sharing your adventures!

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are comfy. Love the styling. Would like more real leather. Feet are wider 24.5 cm narrow heel high arches. Bought 38. Slightly narrow at toe box but seem to be working in okay after 3 short hikes.
review.name: Cute style hikers that do the work

name: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Women's

review.reviewBody: The weather in the SF Bay Area is ever changing. This vest is perfect on what are usually warm enough early Spring mornings. When the windchill effect is factored in, itâ€™s a bit too chilly for my morning dog walks. Thatâ€™s when this is my go-to vest.
review.name: Great choice

review.reviewBody:
The right size.
The right color.
MJ loves her Patagonia Nano Puff vest ... PERIOD!!
review.name: GREAT Nano Puff vest

review.reviewBody: Patagonia makes such  a great vestâ€¦. I have 3 ! â¤ï¸
review.name: Love my vest!

review.reviewBody: I was gifted a vest last year; bought one for myself this year.  A wonderful vest that is perfect under just about anything.  Washes well.  Form fitting for me which is great for layering; that said, it depends on your body type as to fit.    Keeps core at temperature.
review.name: Nano Puff  Vest

review.reviewBody: I was fooled by all "true to size" reviews and will need to return and reorder a bigger size. I am size 6 and S is way too tight as I am planning to wear it over my sweatshirts and hoodies.
review.name: Lightweight and beautiful but runs small

review.reviewBody: I love the weight and fit of this vest! I was hoping for a sightly warmer vest that I could wear on long runs on very cold NH days and I think I have found it! I have a running vest that does not offer much for temps below 30f and my other vests are all a little too much. It also fits nicely under all of my coats for those even colder days or just for ease of having it on all day when I'm in the office and then also being able to throw my coat on without having to take it off. It will be perfect for a warm layer in the fall and spring as well. I'm 5'2 and approximately 110lbs and the xxs fits perfectly. Though I love being outdoors in winter I'm often chilly so I prefer my clothes to fit close to my body to eliminate drafts ;) so for me, the fit is just what I was hoping for!
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: I purchased this vest for chilly morning runs.  Super comfortable and lightweight but still warm.
review.name: Great vest for running

review.reviewBody: I purchased the birch white and returned due darker feathers showing through making the fabric looked stained. All darker colors were sold out so I was not able to exchange.  It will be a great investment.  Runs a tad small, but loved the weight of it.
review.name: Disappointed.

review.reviewBody: I bought if for my wife, she has always wanted one. It's perfect!
review.name: Always dependable

review.reviewBody: I love it
review.name: I love it

name: Nano Puff Insulated Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: These boots are broken in right out of the box and they look like Iâ€™ve had them for years. Super comfortable for all day wear.
review.name: Awesome boots!

review.reviewBody: These boots are one of the most comfortable boots I have ever owned and the quality is outstanding. These are my go to footwear.
review.name: Outstanding comfort

review.reviewBody: The wide option allows me to order a half size down. So great.
review.name: Only ordering footwear with wide options from now

review.reviewBody: It's a great all around boot, I do wish the heel was a bit firmer, but I still buy the boot again.  I wear them for working in the shop and around the property
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: Thus far the Midtown Rambler boots have been great. I've had them for a couple of weeks and have been wearing them with jeans and dress pants. They look just like the ones in the photo and are very comfortable. My family has been buying Ariats for many years and will continue to do so.
review.name: Midtown Ramblers are versatile and comfortable

review.reviewBody: It is perfect for farm work and for cutting firewood
review.name: Good shoes

review.reviewBody: I am happy with this casual boot. The tread is perfect for walking Main Street on a snowy day.
review.name: Good boot with good traction for snow.

review.reviewBody: These boots have drawn so many complements!  They look great and are comfortable. So glad that I bought them.
review.name: Awesome Boots!

review.reviewBody: Great boot and really comfortable. Have worn them several time out already!
review.name: Rambler Boot

review.reviewBody: Born and raised in Montana and currently live and work in NYC. Love the style that puts me in both of those places. Extremely comfortable and great traction
review.name: Great boots for the dirty sidewalks of Broadway

name: Midtown Rambler Boot Wide - Men's

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this travel mug for drinking coffee. Itâ€™s the perfect size for me, and once Iâ€™m back on the road after this next week, it'll be traveling with me everyday. It keeps my coffee hot for hours, which is great, since Iâ€™m a one-cup-a-day, slow drinker. I love Hydroflask! My favorite water bottles of yours are the limited edition ones that have shades of pink, green, and salmon running through them. I bought 3! When Iâ€™m on the road for a few days at a time, it lets me change bottles, which is better than dragging dish soap and drying mats and sponges with me! Your water bottles do keep my water cold for a long time, and is still cold enough at 24 hours.
review.name: Thank you Hydroflask!

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just got a new car, so purchased this. The lid works MOST of the time, but the top is too much extra time taking apart, cleaning, drying, putting it back together = NOT WORTH IT, a regular lid will do.
review.name: IT'S OK. . .

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We werenâ€™t able to take the lid apart. I was given the large mug which I love and it goes golfing with me 3 times a week; but, when I was reloading it with water I lost the bottom part of the straw, any chance of getting a replacement?
review.name: We werenâ€™t able to take

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the flex sip lid with my hot coffee, helps to keep it hot longer and I donâ€™t spill.
review.name: Great mug

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] There's nothing wrong with the bottle - the quality deserves 5 stars. However, I asked for engraving and two things disappointed: 1. The print on the Agave color bottle does not present enough contrast and; 2. There were three words to engrave. Two were on the top line and the one word below it was not centered under the two above. That should be basic.
review.name: Good and Bad

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] paid for an engraving, was not engraved. reached out with no response. terrible business
review.name: Terrible, better business bureau will be contacted

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this , but disappointed, not even keep my coffee hot for 3 hrs. ðŸ˜  my old not branded and less expensive stainless coffee tumbler way better than this.
review.name: Temperature misleading

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I found the lid very difficult to completely take apart, and put back together. You practically need an engineering degree. It was hard to twist off the actual cup without using a great deal of strength. I love the actual cup and carrying handle on top, though.
review.name: About that lid. . . .

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wonderful product. Keeps my coffee warm for hours! Such a great carrier and holds two cups perfectly!
review.name: 16 oz Coffee

review.itemreviewed: 16oz Wide Mouth Flex Sip Coffee Mug
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful purple color and personalization was a great touch and offer during Black Friday!
review.name: Fun hydrating!

review.reviewBody: Bought a set of the 12cm and the 17cm versions of the sender wire. They're nice draws, and super light. Not the best for average to above-average adult hands. The carabiners are a little smaller to save weight. Great for my 8 year old daughter though! Only other downside is that the bolt side biner moves and flips around more than any other quickdraw I've used.
review.name: Very light, good for smaller hands

review.itemreviewed: Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated 12oz Wine Tumbler
review.reviewBody:
I originally bought this to hold water on my bedside table; I wanted something smallish with a lid to keep bugs out. For years I had been using the Camelbak 24oz chute water bottle, but it's much larger than what I needed for this purpose, and unscrewing and rescrewing the cap half-asleep at night was not ideal. This is the perfect bedside cup -- good size, very lightweight, tight cap with a simple slider to open and close, and looks great to boot. 

The first morning I washed it out, I realized it would be great for my tea, too, since it's insulated. This is a *perfect* tea cup, I just use it without the lid. Keeps tea nice and warm much longer than a ceramic mug. So I'm now using this cup pretty much all day and night! I don't drink wine but I imagine this would be great to use for that indoors without the lid or outdoors with the lid to keep bugs out. I plan to slowly replace my regular glasses with these cups, they're just so much more practical than glass.
review.name: Perfect Cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is exactly what I was looking for! Easy to carry in my pack with fuel, MSR Pocket Rocket, stand and a pair of wool socks to keep it all in place.
review.name: Perfect size pot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the removable handle, secures the lid well when not in use (nice that critters can't get in). It's lightweight and the lid is designed very well with the rubber part in the center.
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an amazing pot to take camping or renting airbnb. The material is solid and is perfect to make some noodles or soup on the go. It heats up quickly.
review.name: You need it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the perfect pot for camping. Itâ€™s super light weight and handle can be taken off for easy transportation and storage. The capacity is just right for a pot of instant noodles or hot soup. The heat transfer is also very effective. The non-stick coating works very well. Itâ€™s time to retire my old camping pot.
review.name: Perfect camping pot

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product for free to try in return for my honest review from #Influenster #seatosummit 
I recently had the opportunity to try out Sea to Summit Frontier UL Pot for my backpacking trip, and I absolutely love it. Since this pot is incredibly lightweight, it makes it easy to pack, and take with me when every ounce that I am packing counts. 
The design is really awesome! The anodized aluminum consistently heats evenly and makes it so easy to make a quick meal after hiking all day.
The Frontier Pot has collapsible handles that make it easy to pack when space is a concern. Its 1.3-liter capacity is perfect if you are alone or have to feed a couple of people, and the lid doubles as a strainer as well. 
Cleaning up is extremely easy thanks to the non-stick surface. I haven't had any issues with food sticking to the pot. This will be a staple in my hiking gear from here on out. Itâ€™s practical, durable and takes the stress out of cooking when you are away from home!
review.name: This pot is a lightweight champ!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the design of this product that make it easy to pack without worrying about the space. The pot is incredible lightweight. The aluminum material ensures jt heats quickly and evenly. Itâ€™s absolutely perfect to take camping.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very durable pot and compacts very easily for easy packing. Holds about one can of food and heats up nicely. I like that the lid is easy to attach to the side for mess-free use
review.name: Super nice quality!

name: Frontier UL Pot

hasVariant.name: Fjora Flex1 Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Norrona Fjora Flex1 Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fjora Flex1 Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Norrona Fjora Flex1 Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Norrona and are like this ?? maybe it?s my Norse heritage but nothing fits better than norrona products for me. Best riding shorts I own. I am a 32? waist and ordered medium. They fit fantastically with great adjustability due to the Velcro waist bands. My Endura knee pads fit well under and I can also layer my wind tights or regular johns under there no problems.  The fabric provides a freedom of movement yet doesn?t flap around and snap on fast descents because of the tailored fit. The fabric also is water repellent and mud cleans off pretty easily. A big plus is that they look radical, the pockets are nice but I usually don?t ride with things in there, I have bike bags for that.   the thigh vents aren?t super effective because of the fabric that is behind the zipper, I may just cut out the fabric if it becomes an issue next summer. All in all super impressive shorts, thanks Norrona and Backcountry!! ?? ?? white heart
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
Sizing =  I find all Norrona sizes to be a bit small by American standards.  I am a large in everything American, but need and XL for tops and bottoms from Norrona.  We are just not built like the Norse.   And they run down past my knee cap.  A little long for my preference but can live lwith it. 

Performance: They work well for climbing and riding.   I like the right thigh pocket for my phone.  They have adjustable waist straps so when I lose holiday weight, they can still fit.  The fly zipper is really strong and tough.  The pocket zippers are ok.   The front thigh ventilation zippers really are more for decoration because they don't open much and still have fabric that does not circulate that well. 

Look = These look awesome.   There are equivalent premium shorts from other manufacturers.   But I buy Norrona products because they look super cool and no one else has them.   For that exclusivity, I am willing to pay a premium. Thank you Backcountry.com
review.name: Awesome shorts - Thank you Norrona.

name: Fjora Flex1 Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product. It's soft to the touch yet doesn't fall apart with use. We use it to clean up instead of showering when we're trying to conserve water.
review.name: Soft and strong!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these wipes, as well as the larger size. They are great for those times when you are camping and don't have access to a shower and need to freshen up! 
The scent is light and the ingredients are non-irritating to my sensitive skin.
review.name: The best wipes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] On a vigorous 6-day hike, the wipes made a big difference before putting on a cleaner shirt and hitting the sack. I don't agree eith some other reviewers about it being free of any residual feeling on the skin, but it was moderate and worth it.
review.name: Met expectations

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Except for those times when showing isnâ€™t an option. I used these during my trek to EBC in April 2024.
review.name: Wilderness wipes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have tried numerous retail brands. Even those with least amount of additives still irritate sensitive areas. Sea to Summit wipes are completely free of irritants.
review.name: Awesome Product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worked well, felt like it was worth bringing along and using
review.name: Wilderness Wipes hit the spot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I work out in dry dusty conditions and the Wilderness Wipes hit the spot when I need to clean up. No smell and not sticky!
review.name: Love the Wilderness Wipes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These wipes are great for backpacking. I like that they are unscented and don't dry the skin. I almost always find a way to "shower" no matter where in the wilderness I am as long as there is some water around but use these wipes to freshen up in the morning or wipe my hands and feet before going to bed.
review.name: Love these wipes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My 2 luxury items when I backpack are these wipes and a little chess set. A â€œhooker bathâ€, face, armpit, and crotch wipe down with these after a long day of hiking is the lap of luxury. Itâ€™s like a spa day for backpackers.
review.name: Clean on the trail

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for tending to feet/blisters and general body refresh on the trail. Keep readily available.
review.name: Great for tending to feet/blisters

review.reviewBody:
Purchased a new bike, first one in years and it came with a Deore rear derailleur that was bent, typical of online buying.  However this was a quick cheap fix that works well.  Swapped out derailleur myself and could hardly notice any weight difference between the XT and the Deore, but it did fix my problem.  
Meanwhile saving up for a complete SRAM drive-train.
review.name: no real weight savings, but works well

review.reviewBody:
